sen.j: 那須 資村（なす すけむら、建久元年（1190年）？ - 文永五年（1268年）？）は鎌倉時代の人物。
sen.e: Sukemura NASU (1190? - 1268?) was a personality, who lived during the Kamakura period.
Sukemura NASU (1190? - 1268?) was a person who lived during the Kamakura period.
Sukemura NASU (1190? - 1268?) was a person who lived during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 下野国那須氏六代当主。
sen.e: He was the sixth family head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.
He was the sixth head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 那須氏六代当主→the sixth head of the Nasu clan
sen.e: He was the sixth head of the Nasu clan in Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 五代当主那須光資の子。
sen.e: He was the son of the fifth family head, Mitsusuke NASU
He was the son of the fifth family head, Mitsusuke NASU.
sen.cmt: 文尾にピリオドを付けました。
sen.e: He was the son of the fifth family head, Mitsusuke NASU.

sen.j: 七代当主那須資家、沢村資祗の父。
sen.e: He was the father of Sukemasa SAWAMURA, the seventh head of the Nasu family.
sen.cmt: 那須資家→the Nasu family としました。（那須家の誤りとも思われます。）
sen.e: He was the father of Sukeie NASU, the seventh family head, and Sukemasa SAWAMURA.
sen.cmt: 七代当主那須資家→Sukeie NASU, the seventh family head（那須資村の長男が那須資家であり、沢村資祗は次男となります（http://homepage1.nifty.com/t-kubo/Japan/koutai/nasu.htm より））
sen.e: He was the father of Sukeie NASU, the seventh family head, and Sukemasa SAWAMURA.
He was Hizen no kami (the governor of Hizen Province).
He was the Governor of Hizen Province.
He was the Governor of Hizen Province.
His another name was Taro.
sen.cmt: 太郎→Taro（his another nameを加えました。）
sen.e: He was also called Taro.
sen.cmt: 「那須光資」内の表記にあわせました。
sen.e: He was also called Taro.

sen.j: 念仏宗に帰依し、親鸞上人の弟子となり信願房教念と号し、貞応2年（1223年）に慈願寺を創設した。
sen.e: Since he was a devoted believer of Nenbutsu sect, he became a disciple of the holy priest Shinran and called himself Shinganbo kyonen (信願房教念), and in 1223 he founded Jigan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 念仏宗に帰依→be a devoted believer of Nenbutsu sectとしました。信願房教念→Shinganbo kyonen (信願房教念)としました。
sen.e: When he was a devoted believer of Nenbutsu sect and became a disciple of the holy priest Shinran, he was given the name Shinganbo kyonen as his go (byname) and founded Jigan-ji Temple in 1223.
sen.cmt: 信願房教念→Shinganbo kyonen（漢字表記は、特に必要がないと判断し、削除しました。）～と号する→given the name ～ as one's go (byname)
sen.e: When he was a devoted believer of Nenbutsu sect and became a disciple of the holy priest Shinran, he was given the name Shinganbo kyonen as his go (byname) and founded Jigan-ji Temple in 1223.
It is said that he enjoyed the longevity of 78 years.
It is said that he lived to a great age of 78.
sen.cmt: 長寿を保つ→live to a great age
sen.e: It is said that he lived to a great age of 78.
